channel.title: The peak of teenage stupidity
channel.description:
Challenges.
I personally quit them. Yesterday. I did multiple challenges, the cinnamon challenge and the gallon challenge (four times) included. However, yesterday I did the salt and ice challenge without seeing the aftereffects -- don't [b]ever[/b] do it.
What have your guys' experiences been with these sorts of things? Or just teenage stupidity in general (no drugs, idfc about your drug-related experiences).

item.title: The peak of teenage stupidity
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Taharok:

I would hardly consider eating a raw egg “stupid” or “badass,” lol. There are some genuine remedial uses for raw eggs.

i didn’t say it was stupid or bad ass… i was just simply stating that i did.

Read full topic

item.title: The peak of teenage stupidity
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Skyro:

Lemonade and Banana Challenge.

Explain. Did a quick search but most came up with Sprite instead of lemonade. Also, if you consume that amount of simple food and liquid (from what I saw), you’re going to probably puke just as easily. I’d probably break just from eating the bananas…more than one and they taste weird.

Read full topic

item.title: The peak of teenage stupidity
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Taharok:

Yeah, that’s not close at all to dry ice. Try this with dry ice and you’re going to have a hole in your arm and 3rd degree burns. Good luck!

wtf. Bitch don’t dare me.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:1, topic:443296”]Challenges.

I personally quit them. Yesterday. I did multiple challenges, the cinnamon challenge and the gallon challenge (four times) included.
However, yesterday I did the salt and ice challenge without seeing the aftereffects – don’t ever do it.

What have your guys’ experiences been with these sorts of things? Or just teenage stupidity in general (no drugs, idfc about your drug-related experiences).[/quote]

once i was dared to eat 5 shroom caps… i wanted to die

item.title: The peak of teenage stupidity
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:14, topic:443296”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=545984.msg4002286#msg4002286 date=1338183781]
Ice and salt thing isn’t even bad. It just peels off after awhile and heals.

I’m sure drinking a gallon of milk would feel a lot worse than getting that “frostbite”.
[/quote]
Haha drinking a gallon of milk isn’t bad at all. It feels like you’re bloated at the end, and then if you puke it just feels like your burping a ton. Otherwise, you burp regularly.[/quote]

I hate the feeling of vomiting as it is, so I don’t think I’ll ever try it. I feel sickish after drinking a couple glasses of chocolate milk lol. I’ve heard that your vomit is pinkish after you do it, is it true?

Read full topic

item.title: The peak of teenage stupidity
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

There is no peak to teenage stupidity men
Those of our generations must be killed with fire, or requires therapy
The things you do doesn’t even look stupid compared to people in my school district
The people in my friends school (a mile away from mine school) about every 1/3 kid in that school are potheads
They drink red bull and whiskey (mixed, average mixture of Energy drink and a depressant/alcohol)(Or whatever)
14 year old pregnancy isn’t a big deal anymore.
Nothing you did there, is stupid in comparison
#AIDSSTDS

Read full topic

item.title: The peak of teenage stupidity
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

I did the Ice and Salt on my hand for a minute. My skin turn yellow and then it went away. Now it just itches.

It is frostbite. It’s called freeze point depression. The ice gets into ~-10 degrees Celsius. Pretty cool stuff; it’s how you can make home ice cream.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:11, topic:443296”]Ice and salt thing isn’t even bad. It just peels off after awhile and heals.

I’m sure drinking a gallon of milk would feel a lot worse than getting that “frostbite”.[/quote]
Haha drinking a gallon of milk isn’t bad at all. It feels like you’re bloated at the end, and then if you puke it just feels like your burping a ton. Otherwise, you burp regularly.

Read full topic

item.title: The peak of teenage stupidity
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:7, topic:443296”]Honestly, doing it wasn’t painful at all. That’s why I left it on for a bit longer. It’s basically dry ice, so after about ten seconds you can’t feel it anymore, and it gives you frostbite.

I wish I would have known sooner. It’s also pretty damn ridiculous because there were about ten different things that happened shortly before that would have prevented me from doing it. Almost not staying at my friends house for dinner, doing one arm (which ended up not getting burnt at all) then being told I had paid my dues and I didn’t have to go when everyone else was going (but I did it again anyway, and that time I got burned). God damn, I hate myself[/quote]
I’m sure the frost bite will hurt, it’s obviously not a real one, however, since it’s using ice and salt… that shit could do some damage depending on how long it’s left on there. I thought you did this on the tug or something (oh God), I’d rather do it on the arm or something though, still though… it’s still dumb.

Read full topic

item.title: The peak of teenage stupidity
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Ix Soulcist xI:

That is the most stupidest thing I’ve ever seen someone do…

Honestly, doing it wasn’t painful at all. That’s why I left it on for a bit longer. It’s basically dry ice, so after about ten seconds you can’t feel it anymore, and it gives you frostbite.

I wish I would have known sooner. It’s also pretty damn ridiculous because there were about ten different things that happened shortly before that would have prevented me from doing it. Almost not staying at my friends house for dinner, doing one arm (which ended up not getting burnt at all) then being told I had paid my dues and I didn’t have to go when everyone else was going (but I did it again anyway, and that time I got burned). God damn, I hate myself

Read full topic

That is the most stupidest thing I’ve ever seen someone do…

item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Pour a lot of salt on your skin, and put an ice cube on top. Let it sit there for a minute.

But seriously, before the idea of a “challenge” makes you want to do it, watch these videos of the outcome:
right after: skip to 2:00


a week later:

And three weeks later
